column4: The command "sudo chmod -R 775 /home/xxx/Documents" doesn't seem to work as I continuously have to put a new document there as sudo...
(a) you shouldnt need sudo with chmod, only with chown. (b) you need to change your umask or (c) setuid/setgid on the folder

I need sudo when root is the owner lol:P

so first you should "sudo chown -R username:username ~/Desktop" and anywhere else in your home directory that you have used sudo cp into
that will change ownership so that the files are yours
if you have some folder you cant move files out of ask the channel, don't go dumping sudo in front of everything that gives you trouble
